definition[0]: to wind or twist into a series of rings, or to make something do this
example[0]: The snake coiled around the branches of the tree.
example[1]: Her long hair was coiled up in a plait at the top of her head.
definition[1]: a continuous series of circular rings into which something such as wire or rope has been wound or twisted
definition[2]: one ring of wire, rope etc in a continuous series
definition[3]: a wire or a metal tube in a continuous circular shape that produces light or heat when electricity is passed through it
example[4]: the coil in a light bulb
definition[4]: the part of a car engine that sends electricity to the spark plugs
definition[5]: a contraceptive that is a flat curved piece of metal or plastic that is fitted inside a womanâ€™s uterus
